message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.SD

This paper presents a method for learning from video demonstrations using human feedback to construct a mapping between standard and visual representations. This involves training an autonomous agent using a single video demonstration and using numerical similarity ratings from human feedback to map the standard representation to the visual representation with a neural network. This paper combines techniques from machine learning, computer vision, and robotics, making it likely to belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories. 

The most likely category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), as the paper focuses on learning from demonstrations and using feedback to improve the agent's performance. The second most likely category is cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), as the paper involves training an autonomous agent to perform a task using video demonstrations and human feedback. The third most likely category is cs.RO (Robotics), as the paper involves training an agent to perform a task in a simulated environment. The fourth likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision), as the paper involves using video demonstrations to teach the agent how to perform a task. The fifth likely category is cs.SD (Software Engineering), as the paper involves developing a method for constructing a mapping between different representations.
